stories.title: Frozen Throne: GCP Cloud Run API for Merge Freezes on GitHub
The only thing stopping GCC from becoming the desired boringcc is to find people

stories.text:
I've been asked to help create a system for my community garden to help manage memberships. Right now it is being done painfully on spreadsheets.

I'm debating 1. Rolling up a Rails instance coding the minimum to meet the features 2. Looking for an open source member management system (checks on github are unsuccessful so far) 3. Paying for a monthly service.

Does anybody have any leads on points #2 or #3?
stories.title: Ask HN: Membership Management System
Gothic novelist Anne Rice who wrote Interview With The Vampire dies at age 80
FEMA chief says powerful storms 'new normal' in era of climate change
IARPA and Army to Engineer Next Generation of Computers
Amazon’s outage and HashiCorp’s IPO point to a future with multiple clouds

stories.text:
Which one is the best and why ? Does it support data search ? Can it do validation ? Does it handle well with thousands and thousands of rows ? Are their docs full and up to date ?

I've been looking around at https://jspreadsheets.com/ and tried many of them, but still can't put my finger on which one to go with. My requirements are more on the viewing/grouping/searching side rather than editing/formulas etc. but any impressions will help.
stories.title: Ask HN: The best, preferably open source, JavaScript spreadsheet out there?
